title: Part Time Research Assistant-Fixed Term Contract
text:
Job Ref: CT3397 
The Centre of Sustainable Power Distribution at Department of Electronic & Electrical Engineering, University of Bath is researching all aspects of power system modelling, analyses and planning that underpin the development of key technical and commercial innovations. We have track record of working with the industry, undertaken significant research and consultancies for the UK government, the energy regulator and all UK’s transmission and distribution licensees. Significant of our research has been taken up by the electrical power industry. 
We wish to appoint 1 part-time Research Assistant, who will join a research consortium sponsored by EPSRC and Chinese Research Council to address the operation and planning challenges for an active distribution system when integrating low carbon technologies. The specific responsibilities for this appointment include developing new active network management strategies considering uncertainties, assessing the performance of the new strategies under differing energy landscapes and impact on the future network investment. 
The successful candidate will have experience in active network management and uncertainty quantification and mitigation. 
The successful candidate will work closely with colleagues from Imperial and Cardiff in the UK and three Chinese Institutions and Universities –Tianjin, Tsinghua and Shanghai Jiaotong. The candidate is also expected to work alongside Bath colleagues engaged in other smart grid/smart metering projects. 
This post is part time at 20 hours per week (0.55 FTE) and is being offered on a fixed term contract basis with an expected expiry date of 30 April 2016. Share this job
